alert.note: Alert for Fresno-Tulare Foothills; Fresno-Tulare Lower Sierra; Grant Grove Area; Kings Canyon NP; Sequoia NP; South End of the Lower Sierra (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 4:18PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Tulare and east central Fresno Counties through 445 PM PDT... At 417 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Three Rivers, or 34 miles northeast of Visalia, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Big Meadows, Marble Fork Kaweah, Lodgepole Campground, Potwisha Campground, Park Ridge, Dorst Creek Campground, Mitchell Meadow, Giant Forest, Ash Mountain Sequoia Park HQ, Buckeye Flat Campground and Lodgepole. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
